body_html:
The JNI library contained in the Maven package is CPU only.

However, the way the code is setup is that it looks for the tensorflow_jni library in the system path (see NativeLibrary.java). Thus, to enable GPU support, download the JNI archive mentioned in the README and make that available to the JVM (e.g., via -Djava.library.path)
body_text:
The JNI library contained in the Maven package is CPU only.
However, the way the code is setup is that it looks for the tensorflow_jni library in the system path  (see NativeLibrary.java). Thus, to enable GPU support, download the JNI archive mentioned in the README and make that available to the JVM (e.g., via -Djava.library.path)
body:
The JNI library contained in the Maven package is CPU only.

However, the way the code is setup is that it looks for the `tensorflow_jni` library in the system path  (see [`NativeLibrary.java`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/7303b63/tensorflow/java/src/main/java/org/tensorflow/NativeLibrary.java#L48)). Thus, to enable GPU support, download the JNI archive mentioned in the README and make that available to the JVM (e.g., via `-Djava.library.path`)
